conclusion: Use the ideal-gas equation pV = nRT at states B and C to find temperature in state B.
Read approximate coordinates from the diagram: State C: p≈5×10⁵ Pa, V≈2×10⁻³ m³; State B: p≈2×10⁵ Pa, V≈5×10⁻³ m³.
Compute the amount of gas n from state C using n = pC VC / (R TC) with T = 300 K.
Calculate n ≈ 0.40 mol using the values from state C.
Use the calculated n for state B to find TB using TB = pB VB / (n R).
Calculate TB ≈ 300 K using the values from state B.
The gas temperature in state B is approximately 300 K.
